questions.question: His activities are always ……………….. suspicion
questions.description: If your actions are above suspicion, nobody will suspect you of doing something wrong

questions.question: How are you going to account ........................... your absence at the meeting?
questions.description: To account for something is to provide a satisfactory explanation for something.

questions.question: The job interview was very easy and I am sure that I ................................ it.
questions.description: To ace something is to do exceptionally well in a tough situation.

questions.question: The No-confidence motion was an .............................. test for the Prime Minister
questions.description: An acid test is a test where conclusions are beyond doubt.

questions.question: She ................................... a taste for ballet during her trip to Spain.
questions.description: To acquire a taste for something is to start liking it.

questions.question: Wages have increased ................................. the board.
questions.description: If something happens across the board, it is applicable to everyone equally.

questions.question: Her friend often teases her for not .................................. her age.
questions.description: To act your age is to act as a mature person.

questions.question: That child has started acting ............................... again.
questions.description: To act up is to misbehave.

questions.question: The things that she said about your boyfriend do not ............................... to anything.
questions.description: If things do not add up, they do not mean anything.
